p: Based on the literature [ 76], MCTs are preferred over LCTs for SEDDSs because they have higher fluidity, better solubilization, and the ability to self-emulsify. Grove et al. [ 77] compared the pharmacokinetics of two SEDDSs, one containing MCT and the other containing LCT, for oral delivery of seocalcitol (a vitamin D analog) by giving rats 47 Î¼g/kg of oral 3H-seocalcitol. The bioavailability was 45% for the MCT-SEDDSs and 18% for the LCT-SEDDSs, thus confirming the superiority of MCTs for use in the oil phase.
